snippet: A linguist has concluded that a new language, with unique grammatical rules, has come into existence, created by children in a remote area of Australia.
abstract: Dr Carmel O'Shannessy, linguist studying remote village of Lajamanu in northern Austraila, has concluded that village's children have created entirely new language distinct from area's main dialects; language, known as Warlpiri rampaku, or Light Warlpiri, is spoken along with other languages and only by people under age 35; O'Shannessy's most recent research on Light Warlpiri appears in journal Language.
lead_paragraph: A linguist has concluded that a new language, with unique grammatical rules, has come into existence, created by children in a remote area of Australia.

headline.main: A Village Invents a Language All Its Own
headline.print_headline: A Village Invents a Language All Its Own
